sentences: Meie peaksime seisma lõuna poolt tulevaid tuuli.
Kuidas sa seisad nii kaua ühes kohas?
context: The word 'seisad' is the 2nd person singular present form of the Estonian verb 'seisma', which means 'to stand'. It is used when addressing someone directly (you/you) and indicates that they are currently in a standing position or should be standing. The word belongs to the -ma infinitive verb class in Estonian.
